meanings.definition: A hormone that inhibits the secretion of several other hormones in the body.
meanings.sent1: Somatostatin helps control the release of different hormones.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how somatostatin affects hormone production.
meanings.sent3: The party planner joked that somatostatin was the 'hormone traffic cop' of the body.
meanings.sent4: In the hormone orchestra, somatostatin plays the role of the conductor, keeping other hormones in check.
meanings.sent5: Imagine somatostatin as a gatekeeper, deciding which hormones can leave the body.

meanings.definition: A peptide that regulates the endocrine system by inhibiting the release of growth hormone and insulin.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the effects of somatostatin on growth hormone levels.
meanings.sent2: Athletes sometimes have altered somatostatin levels due to intense training.
meanings.sent3: At the endocrine party, somatostatin was the 'no entry' sign for growth hormone and insulin.
meanings.sent4: Somatostatin acts like a traffic light, stopping the flow of growth hormone and insulin.
meanings.sent5: Picture somatostatin as a guardian, protecting the body from excessive growth hormone and insulin.
